Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: It's truly a hidden gem in a beautiful part of Amsterdam. We happened to be in the area on a Saturday afternoon and were lucky to get a table without a reservation. We were immediately welcomed by friendly personnel. ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: We had some great tasting Georgian food and wine. Every dish was so unique. The kachapuri (baked bread with cheese and egg) was very delicious. The vegan dish had Khinkali (mushroom dumpling), bean stew, and aubergine wrapped walnut paste ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Generally this is obviously the best place with Georgian cuisine that I‚Äôve seen in Western Europe: starting from the interior design which is not following any of the clich√© and in and obviously in the food. All the ‚Äúmust-haves‚Äù were there ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Amazing service!! The staff was super kind, even though we were a large group (10 people) everyone was taken care of. My favorite was the grilled aubergine with walnut paste. They also have a wide selection of Georgian wine made with ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: We were intrigued since we had never tried Georgian food and Georgian restaurants are not so common. The menu is limited and here it guarantees the quality of the food, all home made. We tasted multiple different dishes and all loved the flavor: simple food but well executed. Service was nice as well, we will return.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Excellent service, very kind people. All drinks are from Georgia, including soft drinks and tea's, which I would both happily recommend for everyone to try. Definitely going for the Georgian wines and cocktails next time. Glad to have bumped into this welcoming and out-of -the-ordinary place!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Cozy place with a good service! Meat khinkali are my favourites, I‚Äôd love to have some sauces along but didn‚Äôt see them in the menu card. Khachapuri is super cheesy and softüòã

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Very pleasant place with the Kaukasian meals. Worth to visit if you like Georgian kitchen and wines.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Excellent Georgian food and wine! Great service too!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text:
Perfect place for khinkali lovers‚ù§Ô∏è delicious food and friendly and fast service!
Reasonable price, highly recommended!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Very nice place with great food and pleasant ambience! Grilled aubergines as a starter are amazing. Both khinkali and khachapuri are delicious. Would definitely recommend to accompany the meal with a glass of Georgian wine! Very friendly stuff.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious food and drinks! Lovely people who work there and overall a warm and gezellig vibe. Definitely the perfect place to enjoy a meal.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Very delicious, good prices, friendly people. Highly recommended!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Searched for Batoni Khinkali after reading an article on Georgian gastronomy in the anewspaper. ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Very tasty food, especially the khinkali were spectacular! Also had great Georgian wine. The staff was kind and helpful and made for a good experience

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Enjoyed an excellent Khinkali and Acharuli Khachapuri (mini) with a glass of Kindzmarauli semi sweet red wine. Don't miss the desert. Excellent coffee.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: I've fallen in love with Georgian food since 2012, when I first tried it in Moscow! This restaurant in Amsterdam is simply amazing and I've been here twice already. Their bread dough is excellently prepared for you - fresh and hot when it ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: This is the only Georgian restaurant in town. The starters were great - I would go back just for the dumplings! But the main courses left something to be desired, especially at the prices they are charging. Ask about the art on the walls - it has a cool story.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text:
If you like Georgian food then you are in for a treat.
We had the khinkali mix which was filled with meat, mushrooms and cheese, the mini khachapuri and the chicken with spicy walnut sauce. All dishes were ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: One of the few places to eat Georgian food. It was quite busy when we arrived. They don‚Äôt have enough personnel to cover all the guests. They forgot to give us the menu, whether we already ordered or even to give us a glass for the drink I ordered.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: An absolute go-to! What an exquisite little place on the border of Amsterdam South and Centre. Extending their restaurant with a gorgeous terrace, suitable to fit approximately 6-7 tables, this seemingly small place can cater for a lot of ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Amazing. Service was on point. She even explained how to eat the food with the special cutlery. Really good wine. And the food was delicious and filling. You should definitely give it a try when in Amsterdam

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: You must do reservation as the place is always fully booked. Loved the experience and food. It was super busy and packed. We chose the cheese and mushroom khinkali and it was absolutely amazing. The starter was nice too. The cheese bread was heveanly. We loveed it and will come back.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Amazing food, we loved it! We ordered the starter, and the 2 most ordered dishes! Absolutely delicious. I would definitely recommend, prices are good and the sweet wine is the best. Beautiful location also, cosy and small restaurant. Don't miss it!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: The dishes were very delicious, diverse and for a fair price. Also the wine menu is great and offers a nice Georgian wine selection. The place itself is very cosy with stylish furniture. Only minus was the service; unfortunately the waitress didn‚Äòt know much about the dishes and the wines. However, I‚Äòll be back for sure!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: With the corona measures in town you have to be creative to keep it going. Today we were lucky enough to witness how Batoni Khinkali is rocking it in these challenging time. Such a great food, worth a wait in line (if that happens under your visit). Definitely coming back ;)

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Interesting place with good dishes prepared expertly. I do recommend if you like the cuisine.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: This Georgian restaurant is nice to visit if you miss Georgian food or have never tried it, but the dishes are quite overpriced (it is okay considering Amsterdam prices though) and it is quite noisy in there as there is not a lot of space. ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Great food! It was my first time eating Georgian food and I absolutely loved it. The owner is kind and friendly and the food was absolutely delicious. It's still quite new so the waiting times are quite long if the restaurant is full but to ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text:
My 5 stars go for:
1) The cozy atmosphere
2) The simple menu ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Good place if you don't like long menus with 50 dishes and 26 variants. Simple menu, you can easily go through it all in one seating as long you have company, which will be useful to combat the cheese pie.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: 2 Stars just for the food, it was very delicious. We were waiting 2 hours for Mstvadi which never come. No stars for the Service, the Service was horrible nur the chef sympathic, he cooked just in time. Prices too expensive. We are from georgia too, food was great!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Fantastic,  very authentic georgian restaurant. Just step in and let yourself feel magic of Caucasus. Don't hesitate and try most famous khinkali, wine and many other tasty dishes.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text:
Georgian corner in the heart of Amsterdam <3

Review Text: What a tremendous Georgian surprise is this small restaurant in the affluent area of Amsterdam. We went in without any understanding of the Georgian cuisine. The host was super friendly and seated us on comfy chairs. We noticed that ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: The place is nice and comfortable, food is extremely tasty, I loved everything! The staff is very nice, they explained how to correctly eat khinkali and khachapuri.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: I dont have any word‚Ä¶ Only UAO, CRAZY, DELICIOUS!!!

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: I will have a trip to Georgia soon so I wanted to be prepared :D The food was fresh and tasty but the service is slow. The place is not pretentious, just perfect for a regular dinner out. Loved the eggplant snack

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: I love Georgian cuisine. I was happy to find out this place in Amsterdam. I was so excited about khinkali. Except for the traditional ones with meat, they have plenty of them with different fillings. Anyway, my favourite is with meat, they ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text:

Levan and his team make you travel to georgia through amazing Georgian dishes ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: We have been to Batoni several times and really like it there! The food is always good and the service is great also.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: The duck was delicious, and it came with a side salad and fresh bread that were great.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Authentic (and delicious) tastes of Georgia right here in Amsterdam. From the khinkali (Georgian dumplings) to the badrijani nigvzit (aubergine with walnut stuffing), each morsel is lovingly made by hands with a passion for what they do. ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Great authentic Georgian restaurant in great Amsterdam location. Worth taking a look - delicious food and fair prices

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Yes, good Georgian food in Amsterdam! Very kind service and great food (similar to what you get in Georgia). Georgian wines and hospitable owner. But it feels like he needs some help in terms of staff. Keep it up and we will be back!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious food, really lovely Georgian wine! Our waiter was so nice and was clearly passionate about sharing the food. Very highly recommended.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: We have previously visited another Georgian restaurant so we came to this one with pretty high expectations, but unfortunately we were disappointed, mainly because the khachapuri cheese was a mix of Mozrella and Goat cheese instead of using the original Georgian cheese!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: First time I had Georgian food and it was absolutely delicious. Red wine was also very good.

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Nice food. Thou I bet the chef is a berry enthusiast.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: I really like the taste, the choice is limited but definitely a strong indicator that everything is fresh and express made

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Cozy place with delicious food (khunkali must try!!!) and very helpful staff.

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Only Georgian restaurant in Amsterdam. Limited selection of food, all the Georgian classics. Had khachapuri and some khinkali, both excellent. Lovely Georgian wine, too. If you like Georgian food or have yet to try it you won't be disappointed here.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Amazing restaurant! The khachapuri was to die for. Went there a bit late but was warmly welcomed by the staff. I would definitely recommend and will be visiting again when in Amsterdam.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: A great experience! If you want to try something different and/or are curious about Georgian cuisine, this is the place! Delicious food, quiet and elegant place, friendly service. The wine was overpriced. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Went to this place for lunch on Sunday, lovely environment, delicious food and good service. It took a bit of time to wait for food,but it was not a problem for us at all, in the end the meal was very tasty.

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Review Text: Great find in Amsterdam.  The food is very good, and the Georgian wines selection is great.

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious Georgian cuisine, great service, warm hospitality and reasonable pricing. Definitely recommend it!

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious comfort food! The dessert was exceptionally good (we had the raspberry khinkali with sorbet)! Great service and nice atmosphere!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Joyful experience! It‚Äôs a nice cozy and classy place with delightful some jazz! I truly recommend the Khinkali!

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Georgian food! Incredible. Good wine, a bit expensive though. But everything was delicious.

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Cosy place with decent food, not much choice, but the classics of Georgian cuisine are in place. Not much space, so it's better to reserve a table. Nice neighborhood close to Vondelpark, perfect spot for Sunday lunch and a walk after.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: The dumplings!!! So delicious heaven on earth. Rich in flavour, And filling  Attentive staff,  who know the menu and are approachable if you are unsure about about what to have. ‚Ä¶

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious khinkali and phkali that taste just like the ones we had in Tbilisi. Added bonus: It's not on the menu, but you can also ask for your khinkali to be fried. Georgian wine is also really good. The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming and unpretentious.

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: It's a one of the best places in Amsterdam! If you want to have great food, very warm and heartily welcome and social atmosphere, this is the place to go! One of the best Georgian restaurants outside of Georgia!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious food, really nice vibe and a great service! Would definitely go back.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: One and only place in Amsterdam of its kind. They have a handful of Georgian specialties, and the  Khinkali dumplings are really great, such a delicate balance of herbs and spices! ‚Ä¶

Review Text: It was an OK option for a dinner out. Certainly wine was a highlight of the night. Food not really in my tastes but I'm sure the restaurant is good quality and it's a matter of cuisine.

Review Text: Though I have never been here but I will recommend Georgian food to everyone! Specially KHINKALI and Khachapuri (Acharian!) are my favourites! I will come for sure to taste them

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Great Georgian food and wines. Reasonably priced.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Georgian cuisine is famous because of size. Food is very delicious but too small and too expensive... please guys, you are georgians and you know better how look like georgian food...

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: We were waiting for food for like 2,5 hours and everything was too expensive.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Really good ‚Ä¶ as in‚Ä¶ wildly good wine!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Georgian cafe, a rare find in Amsterdam but unfortunately not quite up there in terms of authenticity or good value for money. Portions are small, food just ok. A bit on the pretentious side, if you'll excuse my honesty (speaking as a partial Georgian here). Come to this place for GOOD SERVICE and EXPENSIVE SNACKS üëç

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: The staff is attentive and the service is quite fast. There are traditional Georgian dishes in the menu. Khinkali and khachapuri are must try.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Unbelievably tasty food! Great service!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: True delight, original Georgian khinkali! If you're in Amsterdam and love Georgian food, stop by!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: I love Georgian Cuisine, however I wouldn‚Äôt recommend to order Khinkali here - nothing in common with how they should be prepared. However, on the other hand, Khachapuri is decent

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Wonderful chique and friendly atmosphere and staff. The food was exactly what I needed on this evening : intensive, rich and warm! Definitely worth going there üëç‚ù§Ô∏è

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Loved the food and the service was excellent - warm, friendly and responsive. We had a lovely evening here and will definitely be back.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Can't endorse there being a Georgian restaurant in Amsterdam enough. It's not close to the best Khinkali I've had and their khachapuri is on the small side, but all authentic and tasty.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: The food and service are excellent, but it is a bit overpriced and the portions are really tiny.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text:

Khinkali with cheese and mint are delicious, and the staff is very friendly.
Highly recommend üòã

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Great place for Georgian food and wine. The most noteworthy dishes they have (khinkali, khachapuri and phkali). Hopefully some more variety will come soon.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Needed to wait for one hour for two khinkali, which were nothing close to real khinkali if you have ever tasted them. Small dumplings with strange mixture of meat, as well as strange spices which you would never see in real dish. Pkhali was also weird. Never again.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Try the kinkhali with meat and the kachapuri <3

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Absolutely the best Georgian restaurant in Amsterdam. Levan is a role model in both service and wine knowledge.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Delicious food and great atmosphere!  On Friday there is lovely jazz music . Combined with the food this resulted in a perfect evening!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Best Georgian food you can get in den Hague,  some traditional dishes are not in the menu, hachapuri could been better, khinkaly are nice!

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Was a bit disappointed by the scarcity of the menu. On the Georgian cuisine side it has just khachapuri and khinkali with 3 filling options. There's definitely a room for improvement!

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: Batoni Khinkali is a small island of hipster Georgia. It used to be a pop-up restaurant, but now they settled on a small cozy square, serving short, but well balanced menu ‚Äî wine and khinkali.

Name: Batoni Khinkali
Review Text: It is so far from the georgian cuisine...
